Articles.Content: ItÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s perhaps one of the lesser known new features in KSP 1.0: when going through the atmosphere you can right-click on a parachute and it will tell you if itÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s unsafe, risky or safe to deploy the parachute at that time. The Chute Safety Indicator mod takes this functionality and runs with it: it changes the staging indicators for parachutes so you can see their current deployment safety in one quick glance at the staging list. As you can see this is a very nifty mod that deserves your attention, it certainly caught ours! Information & download link can be found in the [**forum thread**](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/129154).

Experienced the mod!
This one is well deserved, this information is horribly buried in the right click menu.

Wow, I never thought I'd have a mod featured on here. Thanks! I've been a long time lurker, but only recently signed up when I caught the modding bug. 

Regarding FAR support - it's actually a compatibility issue with RealChute (FAR includes a version of it called "RealChute Lite"). RealChute replaces the stock parachute behaviour with its own, more accurate model. As I result, there's no equivalent safety indicator in the right-click menu that I can access (or at least none that I can find). Since the question keeps coming up though, I'll reach out to **stupid\_chris** and see if there's any way I can make it work.

For some reason I want to pull the cord at:

**Risky**

Remember to pack another chute!
